medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports acute onset epigastric pain and lower chest pain at 4AM on the day of admission. The pain is described as sharp/pressing, radiates to the flanks and back, and later becomes sharp and localized in the epigastrium. The patient experienced associated chills, dizziness, lightheadedness, diaphoresis, nausea, and vomiting twice (yellow bile). The pain has persisted since onset, and the patient attempted to relieve symptoms with Alk-Seltzer without success. The patient reports eating shellfish 2 days prior and pasta/ravioli/BBQ chicken 1 day prior to the onset of symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Breast cancer (Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma, Stage IIIA), hypertension, gastritis, esophagitis, depression, neuropathy, TMJ dysfunction, iron deficiency anemia, chronic low back pain/scoliosis, vertigo, osteoarthritis, nondisplaced stress fracture of proximal right third metatarsal, breast reduction surgery, lumpectomy, cesarean section.
medical_history.family_history: Father with hypertension, niece with unspecified condition.
